alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Hart; Stephens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 07 at 6:08AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Franklin, southeastern Stephens and northern Hart Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 606 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles south of Commerce, or near Nicholson, moving northeast at 35 mph. This thunderstorm was producing torrential rainfall, frequent lightning, and gusty winds. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Hartwell, Carnesville, Royston, Reed Creek, Lavonia, Gumlog, Canon, Franklin Springs, Bowersville and Martin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
